description:
Neolamprologus brichardi is a species of cichlid fish found in Lake Tanganyika, located in East Africa. It is a member of the Cichlidae family and belongs to the genus Neolamprologus.

The Neolamprologus brichardi is known for its distinctive coloration, which includes a yellowish-white body with black vertical bars and a black or dark blue head. The fish typically grows to a length of around 8-10 centimeters (3-4 inches).

This species is considered a substrate-spawning cichlid, meaning it lays its eggs on surfaces, such as rocks or the aquarium substrate. Neolamprologus brichardi is known for its complex social structure, living in large, cooperative groups that defend a shared territory.

Ecologically, the Neolamprologus brichardi plays a role in the Lake Tanganyika ecosystem, contributing to the diversity and dynamics of the cichlid community. It is a popular aquarium fish due to its vibrant colors and interesting social behaviors.
